intro: Pentanema inuloides, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features soft, silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
